definition[0]: to leave a group or political party and form another group, usually because of a disagreement
example[0]: More than 30 Labour MPs broke away to form a new left-wing party.
example[1]: They broke away from the national union and set up their own local organization.
definition[1]: to leave your home, family, or job and become independent
example[2]: I felt the need to break away from home.
definition[2]: to move away from someone who is holding you
example[3]: She started crying and tried to break away.
example[4]: She broke away from him and ran to the door.
definition[3]: to move away from other people in a race or game
example[5]: Radcliffe broke away 200 metres before the finish.
definition[4]: to become loose and no longer attached to something
example[6]: Part of the planeâ€™s wing had broken away.
